page.title: 14EDUCATION IN THE TADLEY AREA
page.content: The division of the area into the two counties of Berkshire and Hampshire is most marked in education. Children in Berkshire (the rural area in the main) attend primary schools in Aldermaston or Brimpton then the Kennet Compre- hensive School at Thatcham or the Willink School at Burghfield, all outside the survey area. Hampshire children go to Burnham Copse and Bishopswood Primary Schools in Tadley then at 11 to the Hurst School which has 1150 pupils and 63 teachers plus ancillary staff, its catchment area extends beyond our area. CSE and O Level examinations in a wide range of subjects are offered but there is no 6th Form. Facilities for further education are available in Newbury and Basingstoke. The only private school in the survey area is Inhurst House School for 4 to 13 year olds.
